WorkItem.Description: CRT functions come in three flavours: ANSI, POSIX and Microsoft.  ANSI functions and some POSIX functions that require cleanup, such as fopen and malloc, have corresponding RAII classes in the standard library: std::malloc–std::vector, POSIX::_strdup–std::string, std::fopen–std::fstream.  Other functions, such as POSIX::_getwd, MS::_findfirst_s and MS::_dupenv_s, do not.  These C functions pose significant problems because there is no way to use them correctly under C++ exception regime.
WorkItem.Summary: Create Samples: C++ wrappers for CRT functions that require proper cleanup
